item.title: Functions in Rust
item.description: Functions main function is the starting action fn = pronounced “fun” use snakecase for functions => fn do_stuff() Functions don’t have to appear in file before code that calls them!

item.title: Intro to Unity and CSharp Hub
Memory Safety in Rust
item.description: Memory Safety rust guarantees memory safety at compile time Variables must be initialized 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 fn main(){letenigma: i32;iftrue{enigma=42;}else{enigma=7;}} this works because the compiler can tell what a value would be at runtime.

item.title: Random Rust Notes
item.description: converting a string to number variable are immutable by default, to change them later you have to set it to be mutable

item.title: Scope in Rust
item.description: Scope in Rust scope begins where it’s created and ends at the end of the block, and through nested blocks.

item.title: Straighten UVs Vex
item.description: 1 @uv.y = @primnum + (1 / float(@numprim -1)); move the UVs of each prim along the y/v axis

item.title: Unity SubScenes
item.description: Unity Subscenes Uses DOTS, lets you dynamically load and unload parts of the world.

item.title: Velocity Vectors Vex Houdini
item.description: 1 2 3 4 5 6 vector middlepoint = point(0,'P',878) + chv('adddir'); float noise = noise(chv('offset')+@P*chv('fancyscale')*ch('multynoise'))*5; v@pushout = (middlepoint-@P)*noise; v@v = v@pushout*-1;
